remarks.format:
## Remarks The TimeSpanValidator class is used to ensure that a <xref:System.TimeSpan> object meets specific criteria. The <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator.%23ctor%2A> constructor with two parameters ensures that both a minimum and a maximum <xref:System.TimeSpan> value are adhered to. The <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator.%23ctor%2A> constructor with three parameters checks both the minimum and maximum <xref:System.TimeSpan> values, as well as whether the validation range is exclusive. The <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator.%23ctor%2A> constructor with four parameters checks the previous three parameters and also checks whether the <xref:System.TimeSpan> value is equal to a specific number of seconds.
The <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator.CanValidate%2A> method determines whether the object type being validated matches the expected type. The object being validated is passed as a parameter of the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator.Validate%2A> method.
